newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat ends lower on improved weather.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat ends lower on improved weather.

text.p: MGE spring wheat futures ended lower after warmer weather graced the northern Plains over the weekend, traders said.
Traders said the warmer temperatures had allowed grain movement to normalize as elevator operators caught up on loading railcars.

"It's important to note that we've gained relative to Chicago as we've had this bitter cold weather," a MGE trader said. "I think you saw that premium being erased today after we got nice weather this weekend. But that could change tomorrow -- there's a new big storm headed our way."
Traders said some areas of the Dakotas and Minnesota could receive up to a foot of snow by Tuesday.

MGE spring wheat closed 1/2 to 2-1/2 cents per bushel lower, with March down 1-1/2 cent at $3.76-1/2. MGE spring wheat bucked the trend seen in other U.S. wheat markets when it failed to follow CBOT soybeans higher at the close.
Traders said a number of commercial firms were scale-down buyers of the March contract.
MGE barley futures closed three to five cents per hundredweight lower, with March down five cents at $6.55.
